sub_fields.label: Schedule or Publish now
sub_fields.name: schedule_or_publish
sub_fields.instructions: Schedule a relative date (e.g. now+12hours), Pick a specific date (25/12/2020) or publish immediately.

sub_fields.label: NOOP
sub_fields.name: noop
sub_fields.instructions: NO Operation. (Does all steps except publish post)

sub_fields.name: clear_cookies
sub_fields.instructions: Deletes the existing cookie file on the server

sub_fields.label: Cookie Filename (.json)

sub_fields.instructions: Filename to use on the server.

sub_fields.label: Video Filename
sub_fields.name: video_filename
sub_fields.instructions: Filename of the video file that will be placed into the /videos folder.

sub_fields.label: Cover Image Filename
sub_fields.name: image_filename
sub_fields.instructions: Filename of the cover image to be downloaded. Will be put in the /images folder.

sub_fields.label: WP_Query Arguments
sub_fields.name: post_arguments
sub_fields.instructions:
This is an array to pass into a 'get_posts()' function. 
The query here will be used, NOT the query in the 'content' section of the exporter.

sub_fields.message:
REST API

This exporter instance will declare a new REST endpoint for services like zapier.com or IFTTT.com to point at.

Endpoint Route

The endpoint route is the word or url path to be declared by WordPress. Any service that points to this new URL with a GET request will have the results of the content query returned.

WP_Query Arguments

This query will run when the endpoint is hit. Note that the query in the `content` tab of the exporter will NOT be used. This overrides it.

Enabled

Make sure that the export group is enabled. Otherwise the REST endpoint will not work.

Due to the code, all endpoints WILL be defined and will work if the the export is enabled, regardless of whether there is a job associated with it.
